availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas "Boone" Judy (Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer and fugitive)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, farmer and fugitive. Kentucky native. Son of Hetty Judy. Married to Mary Ellen Ferguson Judy in Montgomery County, Kentucky, on May 4, 1853. Father of Eddie Judy and Bettie Judy. Farmer in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Charged with the murder of Thomas J. Green in Montgomery County in March 1861. Fled from justice on March 7, 1861.
